content:
✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Good idee, easy and simple

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: brillante idée

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Nice and simple, I don't see any issues with it.

Input section / Cases
* Not sure if everybody knows what "military time format" means. Suggest to change it to "24-hour time format".

* The description of HH:MM is inconsistent with the actual input found in some cases, where the format is H:MM. Please fix either the description or the cases.

Constraints section
* Please mention that departure time is always earlier than arrival time.

Cases
* Please rearrange and revise the cases so that each pair of test and validator is similar. For example,
   • one pair may feature departure and arrival both in AM.
   • one pair may feature departure and arrival both in PM.
   • one pair may feature departure in AM and arrival in PM.
   • one pair may feature departure minutes > arrival minutes (e.g. arrival at XX:32 and departure at YY:12).
   • one pair may feature departure minutes < arrival minutes (e.g. arrival at XX:12 and departure at YY:32).
   • one pair may feature departure minutes = arrival minutes (e.g. arrival at XX:12 and departure at YY:12).
   • one pair may feature depature at 00:XX.
   • one pair may feature arrival at YY:00.
   • one pair may feature arrival and departure in the same hour.
   • one pair may feature arrival and departure in different hours while the trip takes less than 60 minutes.

Thanks.

Thank you for your feedback! I made the changes to my descriptions. Also, I changed the names for the test cases to make it more clear what each case was testing! I believe most of my cases follow what you are saying, it was just hard to tell!

Thanks, it's better now. Would you please also delete the duplicated upload? 
https://www.codingame.com/contribute/view/637051556656e1d7552956372a6d7e1e17e68

Like 5DN1L reported earlier: 
The description of HH:MM is inconsistent with the actual input found in some cases, where the format is H:MM. Please fix either the description or the cases. 

You could add either H:MM or HH:MM
Also in constraints
4 <= [[Departure]] <=5
4 <= [[Arrival]] <=5

I agree with the first comment to state clearly "in the format of either H:MM or HH:MM".

The additional constraints seem unnecessary. But if the author does want to add them, use "length of [[Departure]]" and "length of [[Arrival]]" instead, and also the two variables have to be defined in Input section at the same time. (So adding those two constraints is not that simple.)
Of course the length of the input is ment sorry my bad it also may be optional OFC
